clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of the Infant Truview EVO2 Video Laryngoscope and the Macintosh Laryngoscope in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Infant Truview EVO2 Video Laryngoscope and the Macintosh Laryngoscope in Pediatric Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to examine the effectiveness of a new type of laryngoscope, the Truview EVO2, in an infant patient population. They device will be tested against the current clinical standard, the Macintosh laryngoscope, in patients undergoing surgery at our hospital in terms of ease of use, view obtained of the vocal cords, and ability to place an endotracheal tube.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of bleeding gums or oral injury

arm_group.description: Receive laryngoscopy with Macintosh blade first and is immediately followed by laryngoscopy and intubation with Truview
Use the Truview laryngoscope first immediately followed by laryngoscopy and intubation with the Macintosh laryngoscope

intervention.description: will use the Truview laryngoscope instead of the traditional Macintosh laryngoscope
Intubation using the traditional Macintosh laryngoscope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age less than one year
2. Requiring general anesthesia and orotracheal intubation
3. Weight less than 10 kg
4. ASA class 1-3
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Documented difficult airway
2. Facial deformities
